column1: Arktik (or Arctic) was the language spoken by the folk of the North Pole: the Red Elves
A sample of Arktik is seen in one of the letters: Mára mesta an ni véla tye ento
column2: ya rato nea which translates as "Good-bye until I see you next
column3: and I hope it will be soon."

column1: Although the Letters from Father Christmas are not part of the legendarium
column2: the known sample of Arktik written by Tolkien is actually Qenya
column3: which he had developed by then.

column1: :Category:Linguists sometimes refer to it as Arctic Q(u)enya.
